title: news.com.au — Australia’s #1 news site
text: The NSW government is defending claims election promises have been broken, arguing bus services are being franchised and not privatized. The opposition has attacked the Premier Gladys Berejiklian over the scheme, accusing her of lying to voters before the state election earlier this year. The state transit authority will stop operating in three regions, the north-western suburbs, northern beaches and eastern suburbs. Thousands of drivers will be offered job transfers to the new operators, but doubts remain over workers in administration roles. Image: Getty
